channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: $K$-theory of ghostly ideals for $\ell^p$-coarsely embeddable spaces
item.description: arXiv:2511.22438v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Ghostly ideals are among the most mysterious objects in coarse index theory. In this paper, we show that if a metric space $X$ with bounded geometry admits a coarse embedding into an $\ell^p$-space ($1 \le p < \infty$), then the canonical inclusion from any geometric ideal to the corresponding ghostly ideal induces an isomorphism in $K$-theory. As consequences, we deduce that such spaces satisfy the relative coarse Baum-Connes conjectures, as well as the operator norm localization property for finite rank projections ($ONL_{\mathcal P_{Fin}}$).
item.dc:creator: Liang Guo, Kang Li, Qin Wang
